briefTitle: Prevalence+Significance of Paraneoplastic Autoantibodies in Many Cancers
officialTitle: A Prospective Study of The Prevalence and Significance of Paraneoplastic Autoantibodies in Small Cell Lung Cancer and Cancer of The Breast, Ovary, Hodgkin's Disease, Neuroblastoma and Other Cancers
conditions: Lung Cancer, Ovarian Cancer, Breast Cancer, Hodgkin's Disease, Neuroblastoma
primaryOutcomeMeasure: Blood samples for autoantibody determinations and HLA typing and clinical evaluations via Symptom Assessment Scale
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients with previous cancers or concurrent cancers. Patient has or may have, newly-diagnosed or recurrent SCLC, or mixed small cell/non small cell lung cancer, or neuroblastoma, or ovarian or breast cancer, or Hodgkin's disease in all cases confirmed by pathological review.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient refusal to participate in follow-up clinical evaluations. For minors, parental or guardian refusal.
* Patient refusal to provide blood samples for autoantibody determinations and HLA typing (total 4 tubes).
